org.apache.river.qa.harness

Class AdminManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.qa.harness.AdminManager

  • public class AdminManager
extends Object
    A factory for, and manager of, Admins. This class will create admins for services based on the value of a serviceName string. References to these admins are retained in a table; methods exist for accessing these admins, destroying individual services, and destroying all services.

    This manager includes explicit support for managing a 'global' shared activatable group and a 'global' shared non-activatable group. If this manager is used to create a a SharedGroupAdmin or a NonActivatableGroupAdmin, the manager will retain a reference to it. Once a shared group is created, all services managed by this class will be registered to run in the appropriate group. If the manager was already maintaining a group, the new group replaces the current group. If this manager is never called to manage a shared group, then each service must create a group of it's own.

    If the test is distributed then the admin created for an activatable or non-activatable service may be a RemoteServiceAdmin, and the start method of this admin will cause the service to be started on a host other than the test host.

    The type of admin returned by the getAdmin methods is based on the value of the service property named type. Specifically:

    • if type has the value "group", then a SharedGroupAdmin is returned. A reference to the groups admin is maintained and passed to the constructor of any subsequently created ActivatableServiceStarterAdmins.
    • if type has the value "nonactivatablegroup" a NonActivatableGroupAdmin is returned. A reference to the groups admin is maintained and passed to the constructor of any subsequently created NonActivatableServiceStarterAdmins.
    • if type has the value "rmid" or "phoenix", then an ActivationSystemAdmin is returned
    • if type has the value "classServer" then a ClassServerAdmin is returned.
    • if type has the value "running" then a RunningServiceAdmin is returned.
    • if type has the value "persistent" or "transient" then a NonActivatableServiceStarterAdmin is returned if the service is to be run on the local host, or a RemoteServiceAdmin is returned if the service is to be run on a different host. See QAConfig.getServiceHost for details about the host selection policy. If a remote admin is returned, the service started on the remote system will be of the appropriate persistent/transient type.
    • if type is undefined or has the value "activatable" then an ActivatableServiceStarterAdmin is returned if the service is to be run on the local host, or a RemoteServiceAdmin is returned if the service is to be run on a different host. See QAConfig.getServiceHost for details about the host selection policy. If a remote admin is returned, the service started on the remote system will be activatable.
    • if none of these conditions are satisfied, a TestException is thrown.
    The logger named org.apache.river.qa.harness.service is used to log debug information
    Level Description
    FINE to log starting a service, to log destroying a service, result (or problem) calling destroy

    • Method Detail

      • getAdmin

        public Admin getAdmin(String serviceName)
               throws TestException
        Get the admin associated with the given service name. The host to run the service on is based on the host selection policy. This method is called on the master host; the service instance number is incremented automatically.
        Parameters:
        serviceName - a string identifying the service, which is used as a base string for generating well-known service property names.
        Returns:
        an admin for the service identified by the prefix. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        TestException - if the prefix cannot be resolved to identify one of the admin types.
        NullPointerException - if serviceName is null

      • getAdmin

        public Admin getAdmin(String serviceName,
                      String host)
               throws TestException
        Get the admin associated with the given service name. This method is called on the master host; the service instance number is incremented automatically.
        Parameters:
        serviceName - a string identifying the service, which is used as a base string for generating well-known service property names.
        host - the host to run the service on, or null to select a host based on the host selection policy.
        Returns:
        an admin for the service identified by the prefix. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        TestException - if the prefix cannot be resolved to identify one of the admin types.
        NullPointerException - if serviceName is null

      • getAdmin

        public Admin getAdmin(Object proxy)
        Obtain the admin associated with proxy. The service must have been started by the startService method of this class in order to obtain the admin.
        Parameters:
        proxy - the service proxy bound to the desired admin
        Returns:
        the Admin to which the proxy is bound. null is returned if the admin cannot be found.

      • startTransformedService

        public Object startTransformedService(String serviceName,
                                      ServiceDescriptorTransformer transformer)
                               throws RemoteException,
                                      TestException
        Start the given service and return a reference to the proxy for that service. If transformer is non-null and the admin is an instance of AbstractServiceAdmin, that transformer is registered with the admin before it's start method is called.
        Parameters:
        serviceName - The service starter prefix used to construct the well-known service starter property names
        transformer - A ServiceDescriptorTransformer to register with the admin.
        Returns:
        proxy for the service described by serviceName.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if a communication error occurs while attempting to start the service
        TestException - if an admin cannot be created for the service

        TestException - if an admin cannot be created for the service

      • destroyService

        public boolean destroyService(Object service)
        Stops the given managed service. If service is not in the managed set, this method does nothing. If the service is activatable (and is bound to an instance of ActivatableServiceAdmin), this method will call the admins stopAndWait method, specifying a default number of seconds for the service's activation group to be unregistered with the activation system. Otherwise, the admins stop method will be called. The default number of seconds is obtained from the configuration parameter named org.apache.river.qa.harness.nSecsWaitDestroy. If this does not exist, the value used is ServiceDestroyer.DEFAULT_N_SECS_WAIT.

        The admin bound to this service is removed from the managed set.

        Parameters:
        service - reference to the service to destroy
        Returns:
        true if the admin's stop method was called, or if the admin's stopAndWait method was called and returned a success status.

      • destroyAllServices

        public void destroyAllServices()
        Stops all managed services. Service's which are activatable and bound to an instance of ActivatableServiceAdmin will be stopped by calling the admin's stopAndWait method, specifying a default number of seconds for the service's activation group to be unregistered with the activation system. Otherwise, the admins stop method will be called. The default number of seconds is obtained from the configuration parameter named org.apache.river.qa.harness.nSecsWaitDestroy. If this does not exist, the value used is ServiceDestroyer.DEFAULT_N_SECS_WAIT.

        This method sorts the managed set of services, stopping all non-lookup jini services, then stopping the lookup services, then stopping any shared activation groups, then stopping any shared nonactivatable groups, then stopping any activation systems, and finally stopping any class servers.

        All services will be removed from the managed set.

      • destroyAllServices

        public void destroyAllServices(int nSecsWait)
        Stops all managed services. Service's which are activatable and bound to an instance of ActivatableServiceAdmin will be stopped by calling the admin's stopAndWait method, specifying nSecsWait seconds for the service's activation group to be unregistered with the activation system. Otherwise, the admins stop method will be called.

        This method sorts the managed set of services, stopping all non-lookup jini services, then stopping the lookup services, then stopping any shared activation groups, then stopping any shared nonactivatable groups, then stopping any activation systems, and finally stopping any class servers. Service running on slave are not destroyed; it is assumed that a request will be sent to the slave to cause their local instance of this method to be called.

        All services will be removed from the managed set.

        Parameters:
        nSecsWait - the number of seconds to wait for each service's activation group to be no longer registered with the the activation system

      • destroyService

        public boolean destroyService(Object service,
                              int nSecsWait)
        Stops the given managed service. If service is not in the managed set, this method does nothing. If the service is activatable (and is bound to an instance of ActivatableServiceAdmin), this method will call the admins stopAndWait method, specifying nSecsWait seconds for the service's activation group to be unregistered with the activation system. Otherwise, the admins stop method will be called. If the admin is an instance of SharedGroupAdmin, then sharedGroupAdmin field is set to null after the group is stopped.

        In all case, the admin bound to this service is removed from the managed set.

        Parameters:
        service - reference to the service to destroy. If service is null, this method does nothing, and return true.
        nSecsWait - the number of seconds to wait for the service's activation group to be no longer registered with the the activation system. If this parameters is less than or equal to zero, no waiting is performed and success is assumed.
        Returns:
        true if the admin's stop method was called, or if the admin's stopAndWait method was called and returned a success status.

      • getSharedVMLog

        public String getSharedVMLog()
        Obtain the log directory associated with the shared activation group being managed by this manager.
        Returns:
        the shared log directory path represented as a string. This string will be null if there is no active shared group.

      • killVM

        public boolean killVM(Object proxy)
        Kill the activation group containing the service represented by the given proxy. If the service is activatable, the group is killed and this method returns true. If the service is not activatable, this method returns false. If the service is running on a slave host, the slave activation group is killed.
        Parameters:
        proxy - the proxy of the service who's group is to be killed
        Returns:
        true if the service is activatable and its group was killed

      • getHost

        public String getHost(Object proxy)
        Return the name of the host the service represented by the given proxy is running on. If the service is running on the local system and it is not possible to determine the name of the local system, "localhost" is returned.
        Parameters:
        proxy - the proxy of the service to obtain host info for.
        Returns:
        the name of the host

        public SharedGroupAdmin getSharedGroupAdmin()

        Returns:
        the admin
